column4: I'm upgrading from 11.10 to 12.04. graphical screen was "lost"... I can't switch windows anymore, I can't see "taskbar", I can't press alt+f4 to close current window and see upgrade manager that is below it. what to do?
alt+tab does anything happen?
no, alt-tab does not work... keyboard seems to be "up", because capslock led works
now I can see "gedit" that was opened. it got maximized, it does not have icons to close, minimize, maximize. ctrl-alt-f1 and crtl-alt-f7 works
yes, I can run.
I'm killing every app that I don't need
yes, menus are gone, and also icons to minimize,max,close are gone.
now I can see the updatemanager app...
turn off desktop effects, you may have a window manager conflict
how to do it? alt-f2 did not work. I had to use ctrl+alt+f1 tty1 to kill gedit
I mean, how to turn off effects from tty1?
can I reboot in the middle of 11.10->12.04 upgrade? is this safe?
maybe resolution is set too high?
it is 1024x768 (default for my 14 inch monitor)
what happens if you reboot?
is it worth to reboot in the middle of the upgrade? If I can't fix it now, maybe better wait the 2 hours for the end of upgrade, then reboot, isn't?
don't reboot in the middle.  Is the upgrade finished?
about 2 hours to finish.
well... I'm at work now. I'll take the notebook to home turned on. when it finishes I'll reboot. lets pray for the best :-)
Jordan_U, thanks for your help!
ok. that is a good advice. I was just using gedit to program... but since I had other computer at work I could be using the other one...
make sure it gets a clean restart.  "sudo restart" is you can't get to the shutdown button
ok, I'll take care to do to clean reboot from tty1 after it finishes the upgrade process.
thanks again for your help. will go home now. bye
